verses.roman:
sukhaṁ nivāsayām āsa
dharma-rājo janārdanam
sa-sainyaṁ sānugāmatyaṁ
sa-bhāryaṁ ca navaṁ navam

synonyms: sukham—comfortably; nivāsayām āsa—accommodated; janārdanam—Lord Kṛṣṇa; sa-sainyam—with His army; sa-anuga—with His servants; amatyam—and ministers; sa-bhāryam—with His wives; ca—and; navam navam—newer and newer.
translation: King Yudhiṣṭhira arranged for Kṛṣṇa's rest and saw to it that all who came along with Him—namely His queens, soldiers, ministers and secretaries—were comfortably situated. He arranged that they would experience a new feature of reception every day while staying as guests of the Pāṇḍavas.

purport.content: This translation is taken from Śrīla Prabhupāda's Kṛṣṇa.
